poem:
The Innocence of Cocoa

A cup of warmth, veiled in steam,
Her smile, a flicker of dreams unmet.
Sipped in trust, a tender gulp,
Unknowing of the quiet storm within.
A dance of cells, a silent quake.
In the swirl of chocolate, her last breath,
A whispered goodbye, lost in the froth,
And the world, left colder in her wake.
